body_content.explanation: a long, thin medical device that is put into the urethra (= the tube that carries urine out of the body) to examine the bladder (= the organ where urine is stored before it leaves the body):
examples: A thin flexible tube called a cystoscope is inserted through the urethra into the bladder.
A cystoscope may have an additional instrument attached to perform a treatment procedure, such as a biopsy.
